## Table from a JSON file

This table is generated from a (locally or GitHub Pages served) JSON file:

```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
GETable::renderTable(url="data/df.json")
```


Note the JSON format of the source data in `./data/df.json`:

```json
[
  {
    "colname1": "value1-1",
    "colname2": "value1-2",
    "colname3": "value1-3"
  },
  {
    "colname1": "value2-1",
    "colname2": "value2-2",
    "colname3": "value2-3"
  },
  ...
]
```

You can convert data frames to this format simply with `jsonlite::toJSON(df, dataframe = "rows")` or save it to a json text file with `GETable::df2file()`:

```{r}
df <- data.frame(
  id = 1:2,
  name = c("john", "smith"),
  phone = c("3366-3366", "02-3366-3366")
)

GETable::df2file(df, "data/df.json")
```



## Table from Google Spreadsheet

In order to use this feature, make sure that the google spreadsheet is [**viewable** for anyone who has the link](https://support.google.com/drive/answer/2494822#link_sharing).


```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
GETable::renderTable(url="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KV8XOlBcax3gca5s6Wl7M06nVrpui39hHGXDv-K6gM8/edit?usp=sharing")
```



## Styling the table

Edit the styles in `dfFromWeb.css` to style the table.
